meanings.definition: To destroy or severely damage something.
meanings.sent1: The storm trashed the old barn.
meanings.sent2: The vandals trashed the playground equipment.
meanings.sent3: I accidentally trashed my phone by dropping it in the pool.
meanings.sent4: The reckless driver trashed his car in the accident.
meanings.sent5: The angry bear trashed the campsite looking for food.

meanings.definition: To get rid of or dispose of something.
meanings.sent1: We need to trashed the broken furniture.
meanings.sent2: She trashed all the old magazines to make space.
meanings.sent3: I decided to trashed my outdated clothes and donate them.
meanings.sent4: The chef trashed the spoiled ingredients before cooking.
meanings.sent5: He trashed the old paperwork to declutter his desk.

meanings.definition: To consume a large amount of alcohol or drugs.
meanings.sent1: He trashed too many beers at the party.
meanings.sent2: They trashed all the snacks and drinks at the movie night.
meanings.sent3: The raccoon trashed the picnic area looking for food.
meanings.sent4: She trashed the painkillers after the surgery.
meanings.sent5: The teenagers trashed the energy drinks before the game.
